page.title: 01General Observations
page.content: The survey area is entirely rural, consisting of a roller-coaster like {landscape}of small valleys and green hills. These are covered by numerous fields each bounded by a high earth and stone Cornish hedgerow. Narrow country lanes criss cross the area. At present there are 12{farms}in the locality. There is a trend to amalgamate small{farms}into larger units. Any redundant cottages and barns being sold off for residential development. Just inside the survey area, on the extreme eastern edge, is St.Dominick Post Office and Church. Only a small proportion of the{ {population}are involved in farming, the remainder commute to work in Callington, Saltash and Plymouth.
